nodes.bodyText: Looks like brackets are no longer a thing in 2020 :)
Seriously?
Well, yeah :) IMHO it looks better with brackets :)
It's all fun and games until someone adds a new line and wonders why it doesn't work as it should 😉
I just don't agree. :) We're not coding in 'vi' or 'ed' anymore.

@aloubyansky @maxandersen @patriot1burke , this command is not going to be compatible with gradle. This is why for the add/remove/list extension, I would delegate the call to the wrapper plugin to make this command compatible on both mvn and gradle. If there is no wrapper, then you could fallback to this and if it target a gradle project fail with instruction.
And even more now that I see you already implemented an ExecuteUtil :)
Can you explain why it won't work?

sure @patriot1burke, because Gradle API is not available outside of a gradle plugin, without it, we are not able to properly list extensions (neither add and remove which rely on the list): https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/independent-projects/tools/devtools-common/src/main/java/io/quarkus/devtools/project/buildfile/GenericGradleBuildFile.java

can confirm it doesn't work:
 quarkus add hibernate-orm-panache
Unable to add extension: This feature is not yet implemented outside of the Gradle Plugin.
@patriot1burke fyi sourceType is not used by codestarts, you could remove it. What you will need to do though, is to add the language extension when --kotlin or --scala is selected.
Don't know what "add the language extension" means...

@patriot1burke:

java -> default
kotlin -> extension quarkus-kotlin
scala -> extension quarkus-scala

in the end the --kotlin or --scala are just shortcuts.
@ia3andy Just add quarkus-kotlin/scala extension to create command?  That will trigger appropriate codestart?

should we have a --verbose that would print out the commands actually executed ?
Not sure what you mean.  create executes directly, it doesn't call out to maven or gradle.

I'm suggesting quarkus build --verbose (or even quarkus --verbose build) would print out the command that is executed; i.e.
Running './mvnw.cmd package'
<mvn output>

looks like I can do quarkus clean build and that gets execute as multiple commands. That makes it slower than corresponding mvn clean build or gradle clean build
Wondering if we could "group" these rather than be done separately ?
Ugh...didn't even think of that.  Not sure its possible to do that with picocli without a hack.  I should be able to have "clean" be a subcommand of "build"

haven't played with it but picocli lets you customize the execution strategy. https://picocli.info/#_executing_commands_with_subcommands
maybe that could work ?
creating a strategy was the trick.
I used a strategy.  That worked.
